chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyler A Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Send Obscene Email Messages, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 944.25(2).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Forest County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 10 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.

The defendant may not consume/possess any alcohol.

The defendant may not enter into any bars/taverns.

The defendant may not have any contact with victim K.M. (dob 8/10/01) or any female under the age of 17 years of age.

The defendant is not to use any device that is capable of sending text messages.

The defendant is not allowed to use any social media.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

timeConds.notes: Defendant must complete community service within the 1st year of probation.

supervisions.notes:
All other conditions are the same as count 1 with no additional community service hours.
Concurrent with: Count 1

General Conditions of ES.
Concurrent with: 13CF184

records.descr: Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation
Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation
Amended Judgment of Conviction After Revocation

records.addlTxt: From DOC to Judge regarding credit. JA faxed to Judge Bloom.
Amended
5/19/15 sentencing on revocation with billing $36.00

Defendant Kyler A Williams in court with attorney Steven G. Richards.  Defendant Kyler A Williams in custody.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 11:58 AM. Court - here for sentencing after revocation. Richards has revocation paperwork - proceed to sentencing. State - has revocation paperwork - proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to recommendation - puts on record that the defendant has two possible new cases pending - recommends asks for prison for stated reasons - 13CF184 - #2 - 6 months in FC jail, #3 - 3.5 years in WI Prison System consisting of 1.5 of initial confinement followed by 2 years of extended supervision - concurrent to count #2, #4 - 3.5 years in WI Prison System consisting of 1.5 of initial confinement followed by 2 years of extended supervision - concurrent to counts #2 and #3; 14CF40 - 4.5 years in WI State Prison System (2) - consisting of 1.5 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of extended supervision - consecutive to 13CF184 prison, #1 - 6 months in FC jail - concurrent to count #2, 213 days credit on 13CF184 and 281 days credit on 14CF40 (approximately 20 months in prison once credit is applied). Richards makes final argument prior to recommendation - 13CF1284 - #2 - 6 months in FC jail, counts #3 and #4 - 9 months in FC jai; on 14CF40 - count #1 - 9 months in FC jail and on count #2 - 1 year in FC jail, all concurrent to each other. Williams makes statement. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 13CF184 - count #2 - 6 months in FC jail, #3 - 3.5 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 1.5 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES - concurrent to count #1, #4 - 3.5 years in WI State Prison System consisting of 1.5 years of initial confinement followed by 2 years of ES - concurrent to counts #1 and #2; 14CF40 - #1 - 6 months in FC jail - concurrent to 13CF184, #2 - 5 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 2 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES concurrent to 13CF184, turn any unpaid fines into civil judgment, 216 days credit on 13CF184 and 281 days credit on 14CF40, eligible for both programs while incarcerated, no specific conditions on ES, right to appeal, adjourned.
Sentencing hearing on revocation at 05-19-2015 08:30 am

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: undecided
State's settlement recommendation

Defendant Kyler A Williams in court/custody with attorney James B Connell.  Charles J Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 4:25 pm.  Amend count 1 944.25(2) misd class A - Count 2 as alleged - w/held sentence and 3 year probation costs only on each count - AODA and follow thru, no possess/entry, Emp/school with verbage, 200 hrs co service, No contact with victime K.M. (dob 8/10/01) - no contact with any female under 17 unless related to him, no cell device that allows texting/messaging. State has complied with victim notification and there has been no request for restitution. Connell and Williams agree. Court reads new amended charge. Williams pleads G to both counts. Court goes thru plea questionnaire and finds that defendant is entering his pleas freely, voluntarily and intelligently, waive right to JT, factual basis, accepts pleas, adjudges guility and proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument not asking for sex offender registry for stated reasons and follow recommendations. Connell makes final argument follow recommendations. Williams makes statement. Court sentences to following: Count 1 - w/hold sentence and place on probation for 3 years - conditions of costs, AODA and follow thru, no possession/consumption of alcohol, no entry into any bars/taverns, emp/school with verbage 10 different employers, 200 hrs of com service within 1st year of probation,  no contact with victim KM (dob 8/10/01 or any other female under age of 17, no use of any device that is capable of sending texting or  messages, defendant not allowed to use any social media, voting/firearm rights, DNA with surchage count #2. 65 days credit if revoked. Adj.

per Attorney Connell, this matter is settled and will be a plea and sentencing hearing. He has a conflict with the 1:15 pm time set for FPT. He has a hearing in Langlade County at 2:00 pm and will be in Forest County by 3:30 pm for the plea and sentencing.
State's
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with KM.
Final pre-trial on May 28, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Called at 2:44 PM. Kyler Williams appears in person and in custody with attorney Thomas Roley. State appears by Jodie Bednar-Clemens. Roley provides court with waiver of PH. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. State files Information that mirrors the complaint. Roley has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts pleas, sets for FPT on 5/28/14 at 1:15 PM. Roley - bond - asks for reduction to $5000 cash with no objections to the State for that but would like court to consider a signature bond for stated reasons with strict conditions of no use of a cell phone, not to be in a residence that has a computer, etc. State - bond - no objection to a reduction to $5000 cash as discussed off record but does object to a signature bond for stated reasons. Court - bond - reduces bond to $5,000 cash with same conditions.
Preliminary hearing on April 16, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Called at 10:46 AM. Kyler Williams appears via video from FOSO and without counsel. State appears by Charles Simono. Williams does not have complaint. Court reads charges and penalties and right to attorney and court appointed attorney. Roley is appearing specially now for this case as he has his other case. Roley has complaint, waives formal reading. Court continues bond, set for PH on 4/16/14 at 3:00 PM.
Cash bond set
No consumption of alcohol. No contact with KM.
